alert.note: Alert for Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 8:17PM EST until further notice by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC157-251645- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0017.000000T0000Z-000000T0000Z/ /URVO1.1.ER.220223T1516Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 817 PM EST Thu Feb 24 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillwater Creek at Uhrichsville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillwater Creek comes out of its banks in several locations resulting in overflowing in poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of low lying areas begins. At 11.5 feet, Flood waters of Stillwater Creek will reach the intersection of East 12th Street and North Main Street in Uhrichsville and approach Newport Street. Little Stillwater Creek will flood most of Phac Park along with portions of Wilson Road in Dennison. At 12.9 feet, Numerous low land areas are flooded. Stillwater Creek begins to flood portions of Newport Street in Uhrichsville. Homes along Park Drive begin to flood. Sections of Wilson Road near Phac Park are flooded. At 13.3 feet, Flood waters reach Newport Avenue in Uhrichsville as well as East 12th Street and North Main Street half way to East 11th Street. Phac Park along Little Stillwater Creek in Dennison is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 9.5 feet and then begin rising early tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to 11.4 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will fall to 11.3 feet and then begin rising Sunday evening. It will then rise again to 11.5 feet Monday evening. It will fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.3 feet on 09/10/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
